definition: listener/member of audience
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
listener
to take a casual remark to heart (idiom)
pinyin: yan2 zhe3 wu2 yi4 , ting1 zhe3 you3 xin1

sentences.english: Conviction of preacher passes into truth of hearers .
sentences.chinese: 讲道者的信念，使听者扎心知罪，认识真理。

sentences.english: I am a much better listener, " he said."
Several people talking at once distract a listener.
sentences.chinese: 几个人同时讲话会使听者分散注意力。

sentences.english: Mother and daughter stood pressed against the wall and saw and heard the raging of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 母女站着紧靠着墙壁，看着，听者大火的肆虐。

sentences.english: Depending on the placement, aim this speaker either up or down to point directly at the listener.
sentences.chinese: 基于这个布置，音箱或高或低的正对着收听者。

sentences.english: These reasons operated on the mind of the hearer.
sentences.chinese: 这些道理在听者思想上产生了作用。

sentences.english: And females of these animals can be fussy listeners.
sentences.chinese: 在上述物种中，雌性动物便是不易取悦的收听者。

sentences.english: However, during the one-hour play, only six or seven people were truly appreciating the charming music.
sentences.chinese: 将远一小时的演奏中，真正坐足凝听者只要六七人。

sentences.english: Whence comes it that it suddenly impresses itself on the attention of those who hear it?
sentences.chinese: 它又怎么会突然吸引住听者的注意力？

definition: audience/listeners
to speak in a pleasant and captivating manner (idiom)
see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]
(of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
pleasant to listen to
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
tune/melody
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
resonance (physics)/sympathetic response to sth
(voice, music) suave/mellow/(speech) indirect/tactful
inspiration/infectious (enthusiasm)
nice to hear/worth listening to
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to express emotion/lyric
